summary: Build Eyegic (www.eyegic.com) as an on-demand eyewear services marketplace website combining: mobile optician home visits (eye tests/try-ons), eyewear rentals, and on-demand repair/technician services (Uber/Ola-style).
architectural_notes: Website should support a two-sided marketplace (customers + service providers) across three service lines: home optician visits, rentals, and repairs.
Add consistent illustrative (optionally animated, silent) visuals for key tabs/pages: Mobile Optician, Rentals, Repairs, My Bookings, Provider Portal, matching the existing flat clean style.
Customer authentication should be passwordless via mobile number + SMS OTP (no WhatsApp OTP).
No WhatsApp automation or Truecaller integration on this platform; related flows must remain in-app.
Ensure the latest reattached Eyegic logo design asset is used globally (do not fallback to the old logo) across desktop header and mobile menu.
known_issues: Rentals tab creative/animation not visible to the user (needs fix/replacement).
Header logo currently too small; "powered by lensdirect" text is not legible on laptop/mobile.
Home page hero creative/illustration appears too small, leaving excessive empty white space (needs resizing for better layout balance).
Draft 7: new uploaded logo not appearing/applied site-wide as expected.
Home page hero: "On Demand" text is obscured/hidden by the hero image in current layout.
Home page hero: the word "Demand" is still partially hidden under/behind the hero image (issue persists in latest build).
New logo still not applied; site is still showing the old logo despite re-upload (needs replacement/asset path verification).
Home page hero typography/layout regression: headline and supporting sentence are not staying on single lines as required; text is obstructed/overlapped by the hero image.
Incorrect logo currently in use: site appears to be using an autogenerated logo instead of the user-attached provided logo file (needs replacement with the reattached asset).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Uploaded Eyegic logo image (EYEGIC LOGO for ID cards-2.dim_1536x864.png)

existing_features.title: Create the core website IA and navigation for Eyegic as an on-demand eyewear services marketplace with three primary service areas: (1) Mobile Optician (home eye test + frame try-on), (2) Eyewear Rentals (short-term rental + delivery/return), and (3) Repairs/Technician (at-home fixes, adjustments, lens replacement). Include a responsive header/nav and footer, and routes/pages for each service area plus a clear call-to-action to start a booking.

Implement the Mobile Optician booking flow: collect service type (eye test, frame try-on, or combined), customer contact fields, full service address, preferred date/time (with basic validation), and an upfront pricing display (base fee + add-ons). Provide a booking review step and a confirmation screen with a generated booking reference.

Implement the Repairs/Technician request flow: choose issue type (repair, adjustment, screw tightening, lens replacement), describe the problem, upload optional photos (frontend only, stored as canister assets only if supported by template; otherwise keep optional disabled), enter address, choose preferred date/time, show pricing estimate, and confirm the request with a booking reference.

Implement the Eyewear Rentals flow: provide a rental catalog UI (seeded with sample items) with search/filter (e.g., category, style, price/day), item detail pages (images, description, rental price/day, deposit, availability note), and a rental booking flow capturing rental period, delivery address, and return method details. Confirm the rental booking with a reference ID.

Add a service-provider portal for opticians/technicians: onboarding form (name, phone/email, city/service areas as text, services offered, basic availability), and a dashboard to view assigned/unassigned bookings and update booking status (e.g., Accept, Scheduled, In Progress, Completed, Cancelled). Use Internet Identity for sign-in if authentication is required by the template; otherwise provide a minimal provider access mechanism consistent with the template constraints.

Implement booking management basics: a unified booking model that supports Mobile Optician, Repairs/Technician, and Rentals; booking list views for customers (My Bookings) and providers (Dashboard), and a booking detail page showing status, schedule, address summary, pricing breakdown, and service-specific fields.

Create a coherent visual theme for Eyegic and apply it consistently across pages (colors, typography, spacing, button styles, cards, and section layouts). Theme should feel like a modern service marketplace (clean, trustworthy, healthcare-adjacent) and must not use a blue+purple primary palette.

Add static generated images as brand and UI visuals and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (no backend image routing). Use them on Home and service pages as hero/section illustrations and service icons.
Add new section-specific illustrations (matching the existing home-visit optometrist/technician style) for: Mobile Optician, Rentals, Repairs, My Bookings, and Provider Portal.

Render the new section-specific illustrations on their corresponding pages/sections so each tab destination has a matching visual: Mobile Optician page (/services/mobile-optician), Rentals marketing page (/services/rentals), Repairs page (/services/repairs), My Bookings page (/my-bookings), and Provider Portal dashboard (/provider/dashboard).

Add silent, lightweight animations to these new visuals (no sound), using CSS/Tailwind-based motion (e.g., gentle float, subtle parallax-on-hover, or fade/slide-in) and respect the user’s reduced-motion preference.

Replace the Eyegic site logo globally with the user-uploaded image file "EYEGIC logo transparent background.png" by updating the BrandLogo component and any other logo usages so the new logo appears in the header (desktop + mobile) and anywhere else the logo is rendered.

Update the existing Mobile Optician illustration so that the 4-wheeler van/car depicted in the current Mobile Optician image is replaced with a 2-wheeler (moped/scooter) while keeping the rest of the illustration unchanged, and ensure the Mobile Optician page continues to render the updated illustration.

Fix/ensure the Rentals tab/page creative animation is clearly visible on the Rentals service page by applying a lightweight, silent motion effect to the Rentals illustration (or its container) using existing Tailwind motion utilities, respecting prefers-reduced-motion.

Increase the rendered Eyegic logo size in the site header so that the small text inside the logo (e.g., "powered by lensdirect") is clearly readable on both laptop and mobile, while still fitting comfortably within the header without clipping or overlapping navigation/buttons.
Remove the tagline text "Like Uber, but for eyewear." from the Home page hero description, keeping the rest of the hero paragraph grammatical and in English.
Remove the "Browse Rentals" button from the Home page hero CTA area (the button beside "Book a Service"), leaving the primary "Book a Service" CTA intact.

Fine-tune the site header layout to make the Eyegic logo larger so the embedded text "powered by lensdirect" is clearly readable without browser zoom on both desktop and mobile, while keeping the header height, navigation, and mobile menu button from clipping/overlapping.

Increase the size/visual prominence of the Home page hero creative image so it reasonably fills the existing empty white space while maintaining a balanced two-column hero layout and preserving image aspect ratio (no stretching).

Adjust spacing and alignment in the site header so the larger Eyegic logo looks visually balanced with the navigation links and right-side actions on both desktop and mobile, without introducing clipping/overlap.

Update the Home page hero typography so the headline text "Eyewear Services, On Demand" renders as a single unbroken line, and the supporting sentence "Professional opticians, rentals, and repairs delivered to your doorstep." renders as a single unbroken line directly below it (no unintended wrapping or forced line breaks).

Ensure the uploaded Eyegic logo file "EYEGIC logo transparent background.png" is actually applied and visible across the app (including desktop header and mobile menu sheet) in Draft 7 by verifying the static asset path used by the BrandLogo component resolves correctly at runtime and updating references as needed.
Fix the Home page hero layout so the headline text "Eyewear Services, On Demand" is fully visible (not hidden/obscured by the hero image) and appears as a single unbroken line next to the hero image.

Update the Home page hero supporting sentence "Professional opticians, rentals, and repairs delivered to your doorstep." so it renders as a single unbroken line directly below the headline by adjusting responsive font sizing and/or layout constraints (without changing the sentence text).
Fix the Home page hero layout so the word "Demand" in the headline "Eyewear Services, On Demand" is never partially hidden/obscured by the hero image at any responsive breakpoint.

Add the newly uploaded logo image "EYEGIC LOGO for ID cards-1.png" as a static frontend asset and update the app to use it everywhere the Eyegic logo is rendered (including the desktop header and the mobile menu sheet), replacing the currently referenced old logo asset path.

Fix the Home page hero layout so the headline "Eyewear Services, On Demand" is fully visible next to the hero image (not obstructed/overlapped/hidden) and renders as one single unbroken line on desktop/tablet breakpoints where the hero is in a two-column layout.

Readjust the Home page hero headline and supporting sentence font sizes (without changing the text content) so the supporting sentence "Professional opticians, rentals, and repairs delivered to your doorstep." renders as a single unbroken line directly below the headline and remains fully visible (not overlapped by the hero image) on desktop/tablet breakpoints where the hero is in a two-column layout.

Add the newly uploaded logo image file "EYEGIC LOGO for ID cards-2.png" as a static frontend asset and update the BrandLogo component so the application uses this exact logo file everywhere the Eyegic logo is rendered (desktop header and mobile menu sheet included), replacing any previously referenced logo asset paths.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create Eyegic marketing website and core navigation for on-demand eyewear marketplace (home optician, rentals, repairs)
User flow: browse services and request a mobile optician home visit (eye test + frame try-on)
User flow: eyewear rental browsing, booking, delivery/return details
User flow: request on-demand eyewear technician for repairs/adjustments/lens replacement
Service-provider flow: optician/technician onboarding and ability to accept/manage bookings
Booking system basics: location/address, scheduling, pricing display, booking confirmation/notifications

Create consistent tab/section visuals for Mobile Optician, Rentals, Repairs, My Bookings, and Provider Portal (matching the existing home-visit optometrist illustration style), optionally as silent lightweight animations
Update Mobile Optician tab illustration: replace the 4-wheeler van/car with a 2-wheeler moped (mobile eye care) while keeping the rest of the illustration unchanged
Fix/ensure Rentals tab creative and/or animation is visible and add/replace Rentals animation as needed
Replace existing Eyegic site logo globally with the user-provided uploaded logo asset

Implement passwordless customer login/account access using mobile number + SMS OTP (no WhatsApp/Truecaller), and persist user history (bookings/services/prescriptions/chat history if applicable) tied to the mobile number
Admin notifications for first-time login and for bookings (include customer mobile number) via email/SMS/WhatsApp as available; currently blocked by platform limitations/disabled email feature
Increase header logo size so the "powered by lensdirect" text is clearly readable on laptop and mobile
Remove the tagline text "Like Uber, but for eyewear." from the site (e.g., homepage hero)
Remove the "browse rentals" button from the home page (next to the "book a service" button)
Increase/enlarge the Home page hero creative/illustration to reasonably fill empty white space (improve visual balance)
Adjust site header spacing/layout so the larger Eyegic logo feels balanced (alignment, padding/margins) without clipping or overlapping nav/mobile menu

Adjust homepage hero typography so “Eyewear Services, On Demand” renders on a single line, with “Professional opticians, rentals, and repairs delivered to your doorstep.” on the next line as a single line
